questiontext.text:
Below is an excerpt from the diamonds dataset of the tidyverse package:

library(tidyverse)
head(diamonds)
## # A tibble: 6 x 10
##   carat cut       color clarity depth table price     x     y     z
##   <dbl> <ord>     <ord> <ord>   <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
## 1  0.23 Ideal     E     SI2      61.5    55   326  3.95  3.98  2.43
## 2  0.21 Premium   E     SI1      59.8    61   326  3.89  3.84  2.31
## 3  0.23 Good      E     VS1      56.9    65   327  4.05  4.07  2.31
## 4  0.29 Premium   I     VS2      62.4    58   334  4.2   4.23  2.63
## 5  0.31 Good      J     SI2      63.3    58   335  4.34  4.35  2.75
## 6  0.24 Very Good J     VVS2     62.8    57   336  3.94  3.96  2.48

Calculate the sd for the carat of this dataset.
You can see the text of the Gettysburg address from Abraham Lincoln here. Count the number of occurences of the letter a in this text.

The janeaustenr package contains the text of several Jane Austern novels, (if not already installed, use install.packages("janeaustenr")). Calculate the number of letters in the book Sense & Sensibility.
Who is the author(s)/maintainer(s) of the ggokabeito package?

generalfeedback.text:
Use the R command citation("package name") to find out. Make sure the package is installed on your system first using install.packages("package name")

  1. False
  2. False
  3. False
  4. False
  5. True

answer.text: Yixuan Qiu and authors/contributors of the included software. See file AUTHORS for details.

questiontext.text:
Install the palmerpenguins package if you haven’t already (install.packages("palmerpenguins").

library(tidyverse)
library(palmerpenguins)
head(penguins)

What type of variable is the bill_length_mm column?

generalfeedback.text:
Use the R command class(penguins$....) to find out.

  1. False
  2. True
  3. False
  4. False
  5. False

questiontext.text:
Below is an excerpt from the penguins dataset of the palmerpenguins package (if not already installed, use install.packages("palmerpenguins")):

library(tidyverse)
library(palmerpenguins)
head(penguins)
## # A tibble: 6 x 8
##   species island    bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm flipper_length_mm body_mass_g sex     year
##   <fct>   <fct>              <dbl>         <dbl>             <int>       <int> <fct>  <int>
## 1 Adelie  Torgersen           39.1          18.7               181        3750 male    2007
## 2 Adelie  Torgersen           39.5          17.4               186        3800 female  2007
## 3 Adelie  Torgersen           40.3          18                 195        3250 female  2007
## 4 Adelie  Torgersen           NA            NA                  NA          NA <NA>    2007
## 5 Adelie  Torgersen           36.7          19.3               193        3450 female  2007
## 6 Adelie  Torgersen           39.3          20.6               190        3650 male    2007

What fraction of rows in this data set have missing values?

generalfeedback.text: Make use of the R command sum(complete.cases(penguins)) / nrow(penguins) and adjust accordingly.

questiontext.text:
Below is an excerpt from the penguins dataset of the palmerpenguins package (if not already installed, use install.packages("palmerpenguins")):

library(tidyverse)
library(palmerpenguins)
head(penguins)
## # A tibble: 6 x 8
##   species island    bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm flipper_length_mm body_mass_g sex     year
##   <fct>   <fct>              <dbl>         <dbl>             <int>       <int> <fct>  <int>
## 1 Adelie  Torgersen           39.1          18.7               181        3750 male    2007
## 2 Adelie  Torgersen           39.5          17.4               186        3800 female  2007
## 3 Adelie  Torgersen           40.3          18                 195        3250 female  2007
## 4 Adelie  Torgersen           NA            NA                  NA          NA <NA>    2007
## 5 Adelie  Torgersen           36.7          19.3               193        3450 female  2007
## 6 Adelie  Torgersen           39.3          20.6               190        3650 male    2007

How many missing values are in the bill_length_mm column of this dataset?

Below is an excerpt from the penguins dataset of the palmerpenguins package (if not already installed, use install.packages("palmerpenguins")):

library(tidyverse)
library(palmerpenguins)

##   <fct>   <fct>              <dbl>         <dbl>             <int>       <int> <fct>  <int>
## 1 Adelie  Torgersen           39.1          18.7               181        3750 male    2007
## 2 Adelie  Torgersen           39.5          17.4               186        3800 female  2007
## 3 Adelie  Torgersen           40.3          18                 195        3250 female  2007
## 4 Adelie  Torgersen           NA            NA                  NA          NA <NA>    2007

How many Gentoo penguins of female sex were found on Biscoe?

Below is an excerpt from the penguins dataset of the palmerpenguins package (if not already installed, use install.packages("palmerpenguins")):

library(tidyverse)
library(palmerpenguins)
head(penguins)
## # A tibble: 6 x 8
##   species island    bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm flipper_length_mm body_mass_g sex     year
##   <fct>   <fct>              <dbl>         <dbl>             <int>       <int> <fct>  <int>
## 1 Adelie  Torgersen           39.1          18.7               181        3750 male    2007
## 2 Adelie  Torgersen           39.5          17.4               186        3800 female  2007
## 3 Adelie  Torgersen           40.3          18                 195        3250 female  2007
## 4 Adelie  Torgersen           NA            NA                  NA          NA <NA>    2007
## 5 Adelie  Torgersen           36.7          19.3               193        3450 female  2007
## 6 Adelie  Torgersen           39.3          20.6               190        3650 male    2007

Calculate the max for the bill_depth_mm of this dataset.

The Titanic dataset contains tabular information on survival statistics from the sinking of the Titanic in 1912. You can see this table by typing Titanic at the console.

What proportion of female, 3rd class, children passengers survived the sinking?

generalfeedback.text: Use the R command prop.table(Titanic) and then calculate the fraction of Survived “Yes” and “No”.
